body:
@tqchen Why was there a check?
@vchuravy  if you remove the check does it work with other types?

yikes... started only 1 week with mxnet... pointers how to setup a monitor (in R)? I wonder if label was ever made to be a matrix rather than single vector of labels. I peeked into the source R-package/R/model.R where label is frequently referred to with 'length(y)' (e.g. in mx.model.init.iter), meaning it wasn't expected as (multivariate) output.
I would like to commit this file with the corrected version, how can I do that?
I think this was mainly designed when most operators do not support other types, we can remove that check as long as the bindEx is used
weird... say 1 out of 10 times, especially after switching gpu device and setting learning rate small like 1e-6, I get no NaN's. But then NaN starts coming out again. Even using cpu. weird.
Fine. Let's use broadcast_keepdim.

As far as I understood, this article is suggesting the usage of SVM as alternative of SoftmaxOutput using L2-SVM as cost function. They claim the results are better in this setup.

I'll just start implement this SVM neuron based on what's already done with SoftMaxOutput.

Thanks.
Ok conclusion.
Gradient of SQRT is working as expected.
Only when incoming gradient == 0 it's not stable..
So I will have to stabilize.
I will download makeloss fix to be sure.
Closed.
In addition the change in mshadow breaks API compatibility. Lets change it back and add a broadcast_keepdim
Revised
I think the core of errer is "cannot overwrite directory"
Close this PR since the function name will remain unchanged.

I'll update and merge.

By building a dll to be requied in lua and communicate with python, I think it can meet my need in a short term.
On which os did you compile?
Can I close this issue?
ParamFieldInfo stores the meta info about the fields for generating docstring, but not the content the values.
thanks, this is merged

as a side note. As far as I know, most GPU related distributed frameworks relies on a more reliable env than common data processing frameworks.

Due to complicated nature of learning, and relative small size of the model. Usually a checkpoint reloading strategy is used instead of complicated fault tolerant strategies.
@qiaohaijun a possible interface to lua is more than welcomed.
This is done on the GPU side by a cuda kernel
Getting same error here. Multiple regression output would be fantastic.

### Update

I think the problem is that my browser automatically uncompressed the files when I downloaded them. Although this issue is addressed on the **MNIST** webpage, the proposed solution (remove the **.gz** file extension) didn't seem to fix the issue with **mxnet**. If this issue can't be fixed on your end then it would probably be helpful to mention it somewhere in the tutorial just to give people a heads-up about it.

Thanks,
Steve
@thirdwing works! thanks 👍

Thanks. Seems this is better than tensorflow.

tf always use following code to do embeding:

with tf.device("/cpu:0"):
      embedding = tf.get_variable("embedding", [vocab_size, size])
      inputs = tf.nn.embedding_lookup(embedding, self._input_data)
Thanks very much! I'll read the code.

I think you should uncompress the data set first.

> train <- mx.io.MNISTIter(

+   flat        = TRUE

example的例子页面，使用自己的数据时，
train_iter = mx.io.NDArrayIter(train_data, train_label, batch_size=batch_size, shuffle=True)

val_iter = mx.io.NDArrayIter(val_data, val_label, batch_size=batch_size)

model.fit(X=train_data, y=train_label)

构建了两个intel迭代器，然后fit的时候直接用train_data,根本没用到itel，应该是写错了吧？

正确用法，应该是这样吧

model.fit(X = train_iter, eval_data = val_iter)

It is easy to write C++ Native Op. For CustomOp, as reported there is memory leak in  multi-device, so we still need NativeOp for a while.

Yes, I agree. But since IO failure/restart is quite common in Spark, I think it is required that KVStore workers be able to reconnect. For servers & scheduler, maybe we shall find a way to fail the whole application when they crash.
The most ideal way is not to fail the application, but still occupy the working cell, and just make sure the working ones reconnect and load checkpoints

@piiswrong I can't locate the debug string, so probably it is not mine.

This has been fixed four weeks before. So please use the latest version.
Yes, I tested both with and without random shuffle and the result is the same.

@piiswrong The problem is that the default `InferType` makes the assumption that `input_type` and `out type` are all `Float32`. Whereas simple op requires that `input_type == out_type` so just dropping the check doesn't solve the problem.

I think the correct way of handling this is to require all ops to implement `InferType` and no longer rely on the implicit assumption that `Float32` is correct.
A default InferType that assumes uniform type for all input/output should work for most cases

HI @qiaohaijun ,could you give me your parameters as below. I use your network and my parameters as below and found the result is not desirable.In fact it seems worse than previous. I'm a lot puzzled.

batch_size = 256 
train, val = deepid_iterator(batch_size=batch_size, input_shape=(1,100,100))

lr = mx.lr_scheduler.FactorScheduler(step=10000, factor=.9)
optimizer = mx.optimizer.SGD(
learning_rate = 0.002,
momentum = 0.9,
wd = 0,
lr_scheduler = lr
)

num_gpus = 2 
gpus = [mx.gpu(i) for i in range(num_gpus)]

model = mx.model.FeedForward(
    ctx           = gpus,
    symbol        = softmax,
    num_epoch     = 4,
    initializer   = mx.initializer.Normal(sigma=0.01),
    optimizer=optimizer)

logging.basicConfig(level = logging.DEBUG)

save_model_prefix = './model/deepid'+prestr
checkpoint = mx.callback.do_checkpoint(save_model_prefix)

model.fit(X = train, eval_data = val,
          batch_end_callback = mx.callback.Speedometer(batch_size=batch_size),
          epoch_end_callback = checkpoint)

thanks for the suggestion. I will include these files in the next release.

Is this because reduce speed is slow when parameter is too large?
The default infertype in base operator only support float32 because most ops only support float32. Override simple op's infertype instead

I think we should push forward to make most Operator support other types. Right now `Float16` support is crippled by the fact that some common operators are not supported. 
I am working right now on making pooling support more types and the next on my list is `LeakyReLU`.
Wonderful!
@tmatas  sorry so late, I am training the new network, using your suggestion

So from what I can tell the following operators currently don't support anything than `real_t` e.g. `Float32`.
- [ ] `regression_output`
- [ ] `reshape`
- [ ] `swapaxis`
- [ ] `softmax_activation`
- [ ] `dropout`
- [ ] `pooling` #2280 
- [ ] `lrn`
- [ ] `roi_pooling`
- [ ] `elementwise_sum`
- [ ] `crop`
- [ ] `slice_channel`
- [ ] `leaky_relu`
- [ ] `batch_norm`
- [ ] `upsampling`
- [ ] `deconvolution`
- [ ] `concat`
- [ ] `block_grad`

For my own work I will have to add support for `batch_norm`, `pooling`, `concat`, `upsampling`, `deconvolution`, and `leaky_relu`.

The error I am seeing seem to be coming from mixed type multiplication in https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/5e000e24082201918023ea243622ec0ee051d15f/src/operator/pooling-inl.h#L95-L98 and https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/5e000e24082201918023ea243622ec0ee051d15f/src/operator/pooling-inl.h#L144-L145

The browser example is working fine..., but the nodejs example test_on_nodesj, It doesn't work me... I will close the ticket, and I will try to get time to understand why it is not working.. Will someone apply this change in a pull request?? I

@SlipknotTN How can I build it for android without blas? Running `make ANDROID=1 MIN=1` is giving following error:

```
g++ -std=c++11 -Wno-unknown-pragmas -Wall -mhard-float -D_NDK_MATH_NO_SOFTFP=1 -O3 -MD -MF mxnet_predict0.d \
    -I `pwd`/../ -I `pwd`/../mshadow/ -I `pwd`/../dmlc-core/include \
    -I `pwd`/../include -c mxnet_predict0.cc
rm mxnet_predict0.o
Generating amalgamation to  mxnet_predict-all.cc
python ./amalgamation.py mxnet_predict0.d mxnet_predict0.cc mxnet_predict-all.cc 1
Not processed: mxnet_predict0.o:
g++ -std=c++11 -Wno-unknown-pragmas -Wall -mhard-float -D_NDK_MATH_NO_SOFTFP=1 -O3 -fPIC -o jni_libmxnet_predict.o -c jni/predictor.cc
jni/predictor.cc:1:17: fatal error: jni.h: No such file or directory

compilation terminated.
```
can you give more info about your os, gcc version and so on.?
@piiswrong Thank you. It sounds reasonable,  and maybe i should try it in a machine with newer graphics card.

Hi, first of all I cannot compile with ANDROID=1 and MIN=1, but only with MIN=1 for JavaScript and only with ANDROID=1.
Anyway in your case you need to compile with an android toolchain, not with standard g++.
https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/tree/master/amalgamation , see instructions about creating standalone toolchain and set:

> export PATH = <toolchain_install_dir>/bin:$PATH
> export CC = arm-linux-androideabi-gcc # or arm-linux-androideabi-clang
> export CXX = arm-linux-androideabi-g++ # or arm-linux-androideabi-clang++
The problem is this change can break backward compatibility. Users may have their own ops that only support float32

What's happening is communication cost is dominating. The parameters need to be reduced each batch. This will happen If your network/batch_size is too small.

In general: 
use larger batch_size
use more conv layers and less fullyconnected layers
@pluskid

you need to copy your modified osx.mk to root as config.mk, like this:
cp make/osx.mk config.mk
It's overfitting. You need more data augumentations. The facebook version used these: https://github.com/facebook/fb.resnet.torch/blob/master/datasets/transforms.lua

@MonkeyTang Yes currently the batch size cannot be changed even between different buckets due to an implementation limit that seem to be easy to change (see [here](https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/python/mxnet/executor_manager.py#L302), where the slices for data-parallelism is pre-computed and re-used for all buckets, so all of them must have the same batch size). Can you describe your use case? Do you need different batch size for training and testing? Or you need different batch size even during only the training stage?
Yes, I forgot scale augment. In my caffe  resnet experiment, I use full image to do scale augment. Thanks a lot Eric!

I would argue thought that this is less of a problem, since they wouldn't be calling their ops with input types that are different from `Float32`.

The potential issues I see are:
- Custom ops that rely on inhomogeneous input types, but those would have needed a custom `InferType` already.
- All input types are unspecified `-1`, but that should have been an error from the beginning and also should not happen.
- If an op is called that doesn't support anything, but `Float32`, we might get an non-descriptive error. To mitigate this I could add InferTypes methods to all the ops listed above that specify restrict the input type to Float32.

Thank you for the help. 

Do you know if mxnet with external GPU is working on El Captian 10.11.2 ?

I've noticed a few threads where others seem to be having compiling issues like me... but didn't see any definitive roadmap for getting this working. 

I've been using this how-to for installing my external GPU. 

[tutorial step 1](http://udibr.github.io/using-external-gtx-980-with-macbook-pro.html)  (read this one first)
[tutorial step 2 with automated script](http://udibr.github.io/using-external-gtx-980-with-macbook-pro-and-el-capitan.html)

To get my external GPU (NVIDIA GTX 980 Ti) working on a thunderbolt port... I used automate-eGPU which is an automated script for setting up external GPU's on OSX. 

[](https://github.com/goalque/automate-eGPU)

The only hassle was Mac's built in security, which means you have to 
`reboot into recovery, disable csrutil, reboot into OSX, install the script, reboot into recovery, enable csrutil, reboot into OSX:`

But after doing all that the external GPU install seem to work because my  NVIDIA GTX card is detected by OS  This Mac->System Report...->Hardware->Graphics/Displays

I also installed the CUDA 7.5 toolkit, following this how-to

https://www.quantstart.com/articles/Installing-Nvidia-CUDA-on-Mac-OSX-for-GPU-Based-Parallel-Computing

however, after carrying out some tests   ./deviceQuery

I got the following error

```
CUDA Device Query (Runtime API) version (CUDART static linking)

cudaGetDeviceCount returned 35
-> CUDA driver version is insufficient for CUDA runtime version
Result = FAIL
```

So at this stage I need to try and find out why my CUDA install failed first and then re-try again.

1. Pull the most recent code.
2. set USE_NVRTC=0 in config.mk

I did some further tests and got very puzzled by the results. It turns out that this has nothing to do with hdf5 file at all, but the memory problem only occurs for deeper networks. In the new experiment, all I do is to generate random mini batch data on the fly, copy them to the executor, and run forward on it. I tried to strip the part of training code that is relevant to this problem to reproduce, and here is what I've got:

```

import logging
import mxnet as mx
import numpy
import win32process
from   mxnet.executor_manager import _bind_exec
from   mxnet.ndarray import array

def get_symbol( nDepth = 3):
    data        = mx.symbol.Variable( 'data', shape = ( 40, 28, 28 ) )
    for i in xrange( nDepth - 1 ):
        data    = mx.symbol.Convolution( data = data, kernel = ( 3, 3 ), pad = ( 2, 2 ),
                                         num_filter = 128 )
        data    = mx.symbol.Activation( data = data, act_type = 'relu' )
    collapsed   = mx.symbol.Convolution( data = data, kernel = ( 1, 1 ), num_filter = 1 )
    flatten     = mx.symbol.Flatten( data = collapsed )
    softmax     = mx.symbol.SoftmaxOutput( data = flatten, name = 'softmax' )
    return softmax

def run():
    batch_size  = 32
    nPlane      = 40
    nDepth      = 4
    #nDepth      = 3
    width       = 28
    height      = 28
    symbol      = get_symbol( nDepth )

    param_names = [ name for name in symbol.list_arguments() if name not in [ 'data', 'softmax_label' ] ]
    data_shapes = { 'data'          : (batch_size, nPlane, width, height),
                    'softmax_label' : (batch_size,)}
    train_exec  = _bind_exec( symbol, mx.cpu(), data_shapes, param_names,
                             need_grad=True, base_exec=None,
                             shared_data_arrays={})

    logging.getLogger().setLevel( logging.INFO )
    for i in xrange( 200 ):
        data_source     = array( numpy.random.binomial(1,0.5, batch_size * nPlane * width * height ).reshape( batch_size, nPlane, width, height ) )
        label_source    = array( numpy.random.choice( width * height, batch_size ) )
        data_source.copyto( train_exec.arg_dict[ 'data' ] )
        label_source.copyto( train_exec.arg_dict[ 'softmax_label' ] )
        train_exec.forward(is_train=True)
        memUsed         = float( win32process.GetProcessMemoryInfo(-1)[ 'PagefileUsage' ] ) / ( 1024. * 1024. )
        logging.info( 'Memory used: %s MB' % memUsed )

if __name__ == '__main__':
    run()

```

When I run the above code, I see uncontrolled memory consumption growth. However, if I change the number of convolutional layers nDepth to 3, everything is ok. What am I missing here? Is there anything wrong with the way my symbol is generated?

I check config.mk "USE_NVRTC = 0  "
I edit "CMakeFiles/mxnet.dir/link.txt"  del "-lnvrtc"

@pluskid  Thank you, I need different batch size for training and testing, the batch size of training is same.
When I use BucketingModule for training, my batch size is 50, but I want a test(batch size is 1), I use this way, rebind a new shape. (batch size of data_test is 1)
model.bind(data_shapes=data_test.provide_data, 
label_shapes=data_test.provide_label, 
for_training=False, 
force_rebind=True)
model.predict(data_test)
But There may be a bug, I make a small change, it works. I make a pull request (fix a bug, you should save param first then reset #2290), maybe you can have a look.

@piiswrong Thank you for your reply, is there a way to determine the communication cost (e.g log the timestamp somewhere in the code)? I have tried larger batch size (up to 160 per GPU) and the speedup is still not significant. Cheers.

2 month ago I was able to use it. Now I am facing issues.
[mxnet_predict-all.cc.zip](https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/files/290912/mxnet_predict-all.cc.zip)

Hi @saustar, what if you try the exact files I attached?

If not you can use the command c++filt -n to identify what missing method is _ZN5mxnet2op16SimpleOpRegistry3GetEv.

then you can check if it's missing in your mxnet_predict-all.cc and add it in. You probably have to do this several times to fill in all  the missing methods

Also you can find all errors doing this:

make -j8 ANDROID=1 2> error.txt
grep error error.txt 

to identify the missing methods, use this command:

`ndk-which nm` jni_libmxnet_predict.so | grep "\sU\s" | less

then you find all missing symbols without going to Android Studio. Probably you have a whole missing class which you will have to copy/paste into mxnet_predict-all.cc so that it builds and links correctly.
